channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - World
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.
channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2018 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: 'El Chapo' Guzman's trial begins under unprecedented security measures
item.description: Nearly two years after his extradition from Mexico, notorious cartel boss Joaquin "El Chapo" Guzman Loera faces an American jury on Tuesday in the most significant criminal trial in decades.

item.title: Young Marxists are going missing in China after protesting for workers
item.description: Fear is sweeping through the campuses of China's elite universities following a nationwide government crackdown aimed at silencing left-wing student activists, who had been campaigning for greater rights and protections for ordinary workers.

item.title: Draft Brexit deal reached more than two years since divisive vote
item.description: British and European Union negotiators have agreed on a draft Brexit deal, UK Prime Minister Theresa May's office said Tuesday, more than two years after the country voted in a divisive referendum to withdraw from the bloc.

item.title: Doctors rescue baby from pregnant woman killed with crossbow
item.description: An unborn baby has been saved by doctors after his mother was shot and killed with a crossbow in East London, the UK Press Association reported.

item.title: Khashoggi audio makes apparent reference to Saudi Crown Prince, NYT reports
item.description: People familiar with an audio recording of the killing of journalist Jamal Khashoggi say it contains an instruction to "tell your boss," which American intelligence officials believe is a reference to Saudi Arabia's Crown Prince, The New York Times reports.

item.title: US, UN warn against Rohingya repatriation plan
item.description: The United States and United Nations' top human rights official have expressed concern at a plan to repatriate thousands of Rohingya refugees from Bangladesh to Myanmar beginning this week, warning that such a move is premature.

item.title: Flipkart CEO resigns after misconduct claims
item.description: The head of India's biggest online retailer has stepped down following an investigation into allegations of "serious personal misconduct."

item.title: Don't panic about iPhone sales just yet
item.description: Less than two months after Apple refreshed its smartphone lineup, investors are once again panicking about whether enough people are buying iPhones.

item.title: Oil nosedives 7%, its biggest plunge in three years
item.description: Crude oil prices are in free-fall as fears of a supply glut mount.

item.title: Saudi oil reversal is a win for American shale
item.description: American oil executives will sleep a bit better tonight after Saudi Arabia signaled it's coming to the rescue of the battered crude market.

item.title: Cities that lost out on Amazon HQ2 still won
item.description: 17 US cities didn't land prizes in the Amazon sweepstakes, but they laid the groundwork to become tech hubs for years to come.

item.title: Tiger Woods will win 15th major, says close friend
The Finnish hero of rallying
Double delight in Doha for Big Ben
Meet Formula One's next generation of stars
item.description: There will be familiar names on the grid next season, but 2019 also promises to be the year Formula One's next generation come to the fore.

item.title: Why Finland loves rally
item.description: On a rainy day in the autumn of 1987, seven-year-old Teemu Lampinen stood with his father on the sidelines of Finland's 1000 Lakes Rally (now called the Neste Rally Finland).

item.title: How imagining a 'car crash' keeps this sailor safe
item.description: The sport is solo sailing, but the real game is human management, says around-the-world racer Alex Thomson.

item.title: World's most luxurious cruise?
item.description: This hotel has only 19 rooms, but the sea view is guaranteed from all of them: Gunt is a luxury cruise ship sailing through the Seto Inland Sea in the Setouchi region of Japan, about 100 miles west of Osaka.

item.title: The robot who laughs, smiles and frowns just like us
item.description: The field of robotics is fast-growing. Robots can now perform complicated movements with elegance -- back-flipping, practicing parkour moves, even "carving" classical sculptures.

item.title: What happened to the world's largest painting?
item.description: Less than a month before the end of World War I, a huge painting commemorating the war effort was unveiled in central Paris. Its creators wanted to honor the greatest war the world had ever seen with the greatest painting ever made, and they had spent the previous four years working on it with the help of 150 artists.

item.title: Qatari royal showcases jewel of the Maharajas
item.description: In the 17th century, an exquisite dagger crafted from jade and inlaid with gold was created for Shah Jahan, the emperor who built the Taj Mahal. Two centuries later, it had found its way into the private collection of Samuel Morse, the inventor of Morse code.

item.title: Why was this car hidden away for 30 years?
item.description: If this car could talk, it would describe a road to fame with all the twists and turns of a Hollywood plot.

item.title: The world's most powerful passport
These pilots fly 100-year-old airplanes
How Asia's airports are changing the way we travel
World's first underwater hotel
item.description: For once, it's an opportunity to sleep with the fishes that doesn't mean you end up like a character in a mob movie.

item.title: 10 things the UAE does better than anywhere else
item.description: The United Arab Emirates is famous for its relentless sunshine, its golden dunes that roll on for miles and some of the most ambitious, opulent building projects of modern times.

item.title: Trailblazers on how to change the world
item.description: Meet 10 remarkable trailblazers who have truly changed the world. Each one has found a way to use their knowledge and inspiration to help countless others.

item.title: Tiny houses for homeless vets make a big impact
item.description: Leo Morris served in the Air Force. Karen Carter patrolled with the Coast Guard. Henry Owens enlisted in the Navy.
